explanation: the person or people mentioned earlier
sentence: The aforementioned Mr Parkes then entered the cinema.
sentence_gap: The ______________ Mr Parkes then entered the cinema.

explanation: a man who is about to get married or has just got married
sentence: The bridegroom was late for the ceremony.
sentence_gap: The __________ was late for the ceremony.

explanation: to fill the gaps around the edge of something, for example a bath or shower, with a special substance
sentence: Calk all cracks between the trim and siding or masonry.
sentence_gap: ____ all cracks between the trim and siding or masonry.

explanation: to spoil something or someone so that that thing or person is less beautiful or pure
sentence: It's a shame that such a beautiful area has been defiled by a rubbish dump.
sentence_gap: It's a shame that such a beautiful area has been _______ by a rubbish dump.

explanation: to rub food against a grater in order to cut it into a lot of small pieces
sentence: Grate the cheese and sprinkle it over the tomatoes.
sentence_gap: _____ the cheese and sprinkle it over the tomatoes.

sentence: He gave an incendiary speech at last night’s rally.
sentence_gap: He gave an __________ speech at last night’s rally.

sentence: Cases of infanticide often involve extreme emotional disturbance.
sentence_gap: Cases of ___________ often involve extreme emotional disturbance.

explanation: a shelf above a fireplace, usually part of a frame that surrounds the fireplace
sentence: She has photographs of all her grandchildren on the mantelpiece.
sentence_gap: She has photographs of all her grandchildren on the ___________.

explanation: to eat something by taking a lot of small bites
sentence: A mouse has nibbled through the computer cables.
sentence_gap: A mouse has _______ through the computer cables.

sentence: By ten o'clock I was feeling peckish, even though I'd had a large breakfast.
sentence_gap: By ten o'clock I was feeling _______, even though I'd had a large breakfast.

explanation: to get control or influence; to be common among a group of people or area at a particular time
sentence: This attitude still prevails among the middle classes.
sentence_gap: This attitude still ________ among the middle classes.

explanation: any set of rules about food and exercise that someone follows, especially in order to improve their health
sentence: After his heart attack the doctor put him on a strict regimen.
sentence_gap: After his heart attack the doctor put him on a strict _______.

explanation: (of a person) calm and not showing emotion or excitement
a record or count of a number of things
sentence: Keep a tally of how much you spend while you're away.
sentence_gap: Keep a _____ of how much you spend while you're away.

sentence: Trachea is the tube that carries air from your throat to your lungs.
sentence_gap: _______ is the tube that carries air from your throat to your lungs.
